gov.anl.ipns.MathTools.Geometry
Class Vector3D_d

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.MathTools.Geometry.Vector3D_d

public class Vector3D_d
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a double precision 3D vector using 4D homogeneous coordinates for use with the Tran3D_d class. The use of 4D homogeneous coordinates allows Tran3D_d to represent translation and projection operations as well as rotation and scaling using 4x4 matrices. Basic operations such as length, normalize, add, subtract, dot and cross products are provided.

public Vector3D_d(double[] arr)
Construct the 4 dimensional homogeneous point corresponding to the first three entries in the array provided. If there a not enough entries, 0's will be used for values not specified.

Parameters:
arr - Array whose first three values specify the x,y,z values for the new Vector3D_d object.

set

public void set(double[] arr)
Set the value for this vector using values from the array. If more than three values are given, the extra values are ignored. If less than three values are given, the unspecified values will be set to zero.

Parameters:
arr - Array containing values to use for the x,y,z components of this vector.

add

public void add(Vector3D_d vector)
Set the value for this vector to the sum of it's current value plus the specified vector. It is assumed that the fourth component of both vectors are 1.

Parameters:
vector - the vector to add to the current vector.

Set the value for this vector to the differenct of it's current value minus the specified vector. It is assumed that the fourth component of both vectors are 1.

Parameters:
vector - the vector to subtract from the current vector.

standardize

public void standardize()
Divide the first three coordinates of this point by the fourth component and set the fourth component to 1.

length

public double length()
Calculate the length of the 3D vector given by the first three coordinates of this homogeneous point. It is assumed that the fourth component is 1.

Returns:
the length of this 3D vector.

Returns:

normalize

public void normalize()
Divide the first three coordinates of this point by the length of this vector. It is assumed that the fouth component is 1. If the length of the vector is zero, this function has no effect.

dot

public double dot(Vector3D_d vector)
Calculate the dot product of the current vector with the given vector. It is assumed that the 4th component of both vectors is 1.

Parameters:
vector - the vector to "dot" with the current vector
Returns:
the dot product: (this "dot" vector)

cross

public void cross(Vector3D_d v1,
                  Vector3D_d v2)
Set the current vector to the cross product of the two given vectors. This is set to ( v1 "cross" v2 ). It is assumed that the 4th component of vectors v1 and v2 is 1.

Parameters:
v1 - the first vector factor in the cross product
v2 - the second vector factor in the cross product
